image.altText: Close up of flowers, candles and shoes with a framed picture in the background.

props.synopsis: Bondi shooter Naveed Akram has been charged with 59 offences over the mass shooting on Sunday. Follow live.Follow live.

title.children: Bondi gunman charged as victims mourned

image.altText: Jack Hibbert wearing a white t shirt sat in a pub next to a dog

props.synopsis: The second police officer injured in Sunday's terrorist attack at Bondi Beach has been identified as 22-year-old Probationary Constable Jack Hibbert.

title.children: Police officer shot in Bondi attack loses sight in one eye

image.altText: Yaakov Super holding a tablet, wearing a medical volunteer uniform.

props.synopsis: The rabbi brother of a healthcare volunteer shot in the Bondi Beach terror attack, damaging his lungs, urges Jewish Australians not to "cower".

title.children: Brother of injured Bondi volunteer feels 'betrayed'

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns addresses media on the Bondi terror attack

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns said among the reforms to be discussed were proposed limits on the number of firearms a licensed shooter could own.

title.children: NSW premier flags gun reforms and protest restrictions

image.altText: Image collage of victims of the Bondi shooting

props.synopsis: An act of terror took the lives of 15 people at Bondi. Their names, stories and legacies are held close by a shaken, grieving community.

title.children: They were loved: The 15 lives taken in Bondi terror

image.altText: Alex Carey looks upwards while holding his bat and helmet after making a century

props.synopsis: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

title.children: Carey king of Adelaide for a day as emotional century saves Australia

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, son of former AFL star Stephen Silvagni, will have to serve at least three years and three months of his sentence.

title.children: Tom Silvagni, son of AFL star, sentenced to six years' jail for rape

image.altText: An image of a boat parked on a suburban street, with parts of the boat blurred.

props.synopsis: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

title.children: NSW man denied bail for 'blatant' alleged display of Nazi symbols on boat

image.altText: An office building, with a sign that reads 'ACT Government'.

props.synopsis: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.

title.children: Home buyers hit by harsh debt pursuit, inquiry finds

image.altText: Tim Tszyu walks into the Sydney Entertainment Centre

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu faces a make-or-break test against unbeaten American Anthony Velazquez at the Sydney Entertainment Centre. Follow live.

title.children: Tim Tszyu returns to Sydney in make-or-break, career-defining fight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sam Goodman vs Tyler Blizzard, tale of the tape
Callum Peters wins Australian middleweight title by TKO
Callum Peters vs Cody Beekin, tale of the tape

image.altText: A woman sitting at a desk with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

title.children: These charts show how Australians are spending their time

image.altText: A screen shot of a Tamika talking to the camera, long blonde hair, flowers in the hair, low-cut dress, crystal chandelier.

props.synopsis: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

title.children: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned

image.altText: A close-up side-on shot of Marlion Pickett with his head slightly bowed.

props.synopsis: Dual Richmond premiership player Marlion Pickett receives a suspended prison term for possessing and dealing with proceeds of crime, in what a judge calls a "line-ball decision".

title.children: Ex-AFL star Marlion Pickett sentenced in 'line-ball decision'

image.altText: An empty and dirty glass mineral water bottle held up in a forest.

props.synopsis: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

title.children: 'Potential shelter' found in bushland search for Celine Cremer

image.altText: close up of child's foot playing with soccer ball on the grass

props.synopsis: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

title.children: The details we share about our kids online that are riskier than photos

image.altText: A man walking through the Fushimi Inari Shrine in Kyoto, Japan

props.synopsis: Your task in the ABC Places quiz is to correctly identify the location shown in each of 10 photos. Grab your passport and let's go.

title.children: ABC Places quiz: Find your way around the world

image.altText: North Korean leader Kim Jong-il visits a military unit

props.synopsis: The death of North Korean leader Kim Jong-il was such a closely guarded secret that few outside the North Korean elite would even have guessed anything was amiss.

title.children: The 51-hour secret North Korea was desperate to protect

image.altText: Exterior of the fitzroy community school - a brick building painted with a mural of rolling fields with a sunset

props.synopsis: The school that inspired author John Marsden is facing potential legal action from parents over allegations of physical abuse.

title.children: Parents threaten legal action over abuse allegations at 'cult-like' school

image.altText: A teenage girl smiling front of a sunset

props.synopsis: Annabelle Klint-Pedersen was celebrating the end of year 12 with friends on the Sunshine Coast when an innocent trip to watch the sunset went tragically wrong.

title.children: Father pays tribute to 'loving' teenage daughter after lookout death

image.altText: The old  railway line leading up to a crossing.

props.synopsis: Talison Lithium rules out reopening a century-old rail line from the world's biggest lithium mine, despite ongoing complaints about truck traffic and dust.

title.children: Miner refuses to revive rail line from world's biggest lithium mine

image.altText: A man in an open-necked white shirt.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane Greens councillor rejects claims she distributed an "antisemitic" council-funded newsletter as "shameful and defamatory".

title.children: Greens councillor rejects 'antisemitic' newsletter claims from mayor

image.altText: An older man in a suit stands behind a lecturn with another man standing beside him, in front of Noosa council sign.

props.synopsis: The Noosa Council is now blaming human error for a major fraud incident that cost ratepayers millions of dollars — while not acknowledging earlier supplier scam warnings.

title.children: Council says 'human error' cost ratepayers millions in AI scam

image.altText: A woman with short stands in front of the base of a large spotted gum looking friendly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

title.children: Push to recognise home of 70-metre-tall 'world champion' spotted gum

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Katy Gallagher stand behind podiums at a press conference in an indoor room

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Finance Minister Katy Gallagher hand down their first budget update since the 2025 federal election.

title.children: Short-term spending rises despite overall budget improvement

image.altText: A man in sunglasses speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

title.children: Tom's son was killed in a horror crash. Today the driver got the maximum penalty

image.altText: Aboriginal man with blue shirt and tie posing with his award

props.synopsis: Police allege Cyril Mark Yeeda sold $45,000 worth of alcohol in dry communities for $170,000.

title.children: Prominent Halls Creek man faces court for alleged sly grogging

image.altText: A group of cricket fans watch on during sunset

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.

title.children: Cricket Australia reveals future of day-night Tests

image.altText: A screenshot from a security camera shows a masked man walking along a street. A blue circle is around him.

props.synopsis: Police say the footage shows the suspect "casing" the area around the campus before the attack.

title.children: FBI releases footage of Brown University shooting suspect

image.altText: A close up image of donald trump speaking at the wihte house

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's move comes a week after the United States seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

title.children: Trump orders Venezuela oil blockade, labelling it a 'terrorist' regime

image.altText: Nick Reiner on the red carpet in September 2025

props.synopsis: Prosecutors will charge the son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of murder.

title.children: Nick Reiner to be charged over Rob Reiner's death

image.altText: A woman kneels next to a massive washed up ray on a sandy beach with another few dead rays behind her.

props.synopsis: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

title.children: Deaths of rays and sharks blamed on algal bloom

image.altText: crash scene on rural road

props.synopsis: A teenage boy and a 51-year-old woman from Papua New Guinea have been identified as victims of a fatal crash in Northern Victoria.

title.children: PNG community seeking support to repatriate victims of minivan crash

image.altText: Smoke and flames over farmland.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old farmer dies helping fight a fire in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern region.

title.children: Second farmer dies within a month battling bushfires in WA's south

image.altText: Terence Crawford celebrates with both arms aloft

props.synopsis: Multi-division, undefeated world champion Terence Crawford has called time on his legendary boxing career and will hang up the gloves at age 38.

title.children: The best boxer in the world just retired at the peak of his powers

image.altText: A man holding a fish

props.synopsis: An important apex predator died out 100 years ago due to overfishing and land clearing. Now, a close relative is bringing balance back to the habitat.

title.children: Apex predator returns to major river system, 100 years after extinction event
